text:
This was composed by Nobuo Uematsu, creator of amazing themes such as Dancing Mad, One Winged Angel, The Extreme, and Dark Messenger. 
If you STILL think any other theme in the Smash series is better, then you're wrong
author: Brenton Taylor

text: Midnight release, have to show up for tournament! But oh no! A hailstorm is happening! And the streets are packed with vehicles, cars are literally all over the side of the road along with ambulances and such. I push on anyway. However, I nearly wreck in the terrible icy roads. I get out, and ush the vehicle the rest of the way(about 2 miles), finding the strength to do so before release, walk in, win tournament, get my game. Car works fine suddenly, and weather stops. Worth it? Hell yes.

author: Sephiko

text:
I'm not a big Smash Bros player. I find it fun for a couple games sometimes but that's about it, I've mostly played the first one on the N64. I know it has a crazy big fanbase though with a lot of active players.

Brawl has quite the soundtrack though when you look at the various composers who worked on it. I was happy to see Naruke (Wild Arms composer) arrange two popular themes (OoT Medley and Stickerbrush Symphony). And this original theme by Uematsu is already a classic now.
author: SupraDarky
